name: day2
description: <!-- let and const: Block-scoped variables with let and const. Arrow Functions: Concise function syntax using => notation. Classes: Class syntax for object-oriented programming. Modules: Standardized module system for organizing and reusing code. Template Literals: Enhanced string literals with embedded expressions using backticks. Destructuring Assignment: Extracting values from arrays or objects into variables. Default Parameters: Default values for function parameters. Rest Parameters: Gathering remaining arguments into an array. Spread Syntax: Spreading elements of an iterable (e.g., array) into multiple elements. Enhanced Object Literals: Shorthand syntax for defining object properties. Promises: Improved handling of asynchronous operations. Symbol: A new primitive type for unique identifiers. Iterators: Custom iteration using iterable objects and Symbol.iterator. Generators: Special kind of function that can pause and resume. Map and Set: New built-in data structures for key-value mappings and unique values. WeakMap and WeakSet: Collections that allow weak references to objects. Proxy: Customized behavior for fundamental operations on objects. Reflect: API for working with JavaScript objects and functions. Array.from(): Convert array-like or iterable objects to arrays. Array.of(): Create an array from a variable number of arguments. Array Methods: New array methods like find(), findIndex(), includes(), etc. -->
